intro: Lasiarrhenum confundum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Lasiarrhenum confundum requires bright, indirect light and moderate watering to flourish.
